news.title: Guidance for police on sharing suspects' ethnicity must change, home secretary says
news.summary: The home secretary says the public 'need to have more information' about those suspected of crime.

news.title: What are the rules around police giving out a suspect's nationality?
news.summary: Home Secretary Yvette Cooper says guidance on what police reveal about suspects "needs to change".

news.title: The Repair Shop's Jay Blades charged with rape
news.summary: The TV presenter is due to appear at Telford magistrates' court later this month.

news.title: Netanyahu to propose full reoccupation of Gaza, Israeli media report
news.summary: The plan will involve a complete takeover of Gaza, but reportedly faces opposition from military chiefs.

news.title: Footballer Thomas Partey granted bail on rape charges
news.summary: The former Arsenal midfielder has been given conditional bail

news.title: Home secretary won't say how many migrants will be returned to France in new scheme
news.summary: The “one-in, one-out” pilot scheme comes into force and will see some migrants arriving in the UK returned to France.

news.title: £100m of premium bond prizes remain unclaimed
news.summary: Critics want the system used to trace accounts to be reformed so people do not miss out on prizes.

news.title: Adoption support charity shreds photos and letters from birth parents to save space
news.summary: Birthlink has been fined £18,000 after shredding the files to free up space in its filing cabinets four years ago.

news.title: Nasa to put nuclear reactor on the Moon by 2030 - US media
news.summary: The reactor would provide power for humans on the Moon but there are questions about feasability.

news.title: Why Donald Trump is talking about actress Sydney Sweeney
news.summary: The actress stars in a controversial American Eagle advert that has become a political flashpoint in the US.
